# Task: Create Project Directory Structure

## What
Create the complete directory scaffolding for the Jekyll site as specified in PLAN.md.

## Why
Jekyll has strict conventions about directory naming. The underscore-prefixed directories have special meaning:
- `_layouts/` - Page templates (default, page, post)
- `_includes/` - Reusable HTML partials (header, footer)
- `_posts/` - Blog posts (date-prefixed markdown files)
- `_data/` - Structured data files (YAML/JSON, like navigation)
- `assets/` - Static files (CSS, images, PDFs)

## Directory Tree to Create
```
_data/
_layouts/
_includes/
_posts/
assets/
assets/css/
assets/images/
assets/files/
```

## Implementation Notes
- All directories should be empty initially (files added by subsequent tasks)
- Git doesn't track empty directories, so either:
  - Add a .gitkeep to each, OR
  - Create the directories when adding files (preferred)
- The `_posts/` directory starts empty intentionally (blog content is post-MVP)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All directories exist
- [ ] Directory names match Jekyll conventions exactly
- [ ] No typos in underscore prefixes

## Parent Epic
[EPIC] Project Foundation & Jekyll Setup

## Blocks
- All layout and include creation tasks
- All page creation tasks
- All asset creation tasks

title: Refine typography scale and rhythm
[EPIC] Phase 1: Foundation - Typography & Spacing
description:
# Overview

Establish the invisible foundation that makes world-class design possible: refined typography and generous spacing. This phase creates the "luxury of space" that distinguishes premium sites from merely functional ones.

## Background & Justification

Typography and spacing are the foundation of all great design. Stripe, Linear, and Vercel all share:
- Generous whitespace that lets content breathe
- Carefully calibrated type scales with optical adjustments
- Consistent vertical rhythm that creates visual harmony

Current state: Our typography is functional but not refined. Spacing is adequate but not luxurious. There's no clear vertical rhythm system.

## Goals

1. Create a refined typography scale with optical sizing adjustments
2. Implement a generous spacing system that creates visual luxury
3. Establish vertical rhythm across all content types
4. Optimize typography specifically for mobile reading

## Why This Phase Comes First

Everything else builds on this foundation:
- Cards and surfaces need consistent padding (spacing system)
- Animations need elements properly spaced to look good in motion
- Hero section needs refined typography to have impact
- Mobile optimization starts with readable, well-spaced type

## Technical Approach

### Typography Scale (Desktop)
- Display/Hero: 3.5-4rem, tight tracking (letter-spacing: -0.02em)
- H1: 2rem with text-shadow glow
- H2: 1.5rem
- Body: 16px, line-height 1.7
- Small/Meta: 0.9rem

### Typography Scale (Mobile)
- Larger base font: 17-18px for thumb-held distance
- Increased line-height: 1.7-1.8 for easier scanning
- Shorter line lengths: Max 75 characters
- Tighter headline sizing (scale down more aggressively)

### Spacing System
- Section padding: 120px 0 (desktop), 64px 0 (mobile)
- Content max-width: 800px (prose), 1200px (cards)
- Paragraph margin-bottom: 24px (desktop), 20px (mobile)
- Element gap: 32px (desktop), 24px (mobile)

### Vertical Rhythm
- Base unit: 8px
- All spacing should be multiples of 8px
- Consistent heading margins based on rhythm

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Typography scale implemented with CSS custom properties
- [ ] Spacing tokens defined and applied consistently
- [ ] Vertical rhythm visible when overlay grid applied
- [ ] Mobile typography optimized (larger base, better line-height)
- [ ] All pages look noticeably more "breathable" and refined
- [ ] No regression in readability or accessibility

## Dependencies

- None (this is the foundation phase)
- Blocked by: Nothing
- Blocks: Phase 2, Phase 3, Phase 4 (all depend on this foundation)

## Considerations for Future Work

- Typography tokens should be CSS custom properties for easy theming
- Consider adding a "display" font variant for hero headlines
- Spacing system should use logical properties (margin-block, padding-inline) for RTL support
- Document the type scale in comments for future maintainers

# Task: Create default.html Base Layout

## What
Create the base HTML template that all other layouts extend.

## Why
- Single source for HTML structure (doctype, head, body)
- Ensures consistent meta tags across all pages
- Includes SEO tags and feed link automatically
- Defines where header, content, and footer appear

## Template Structure
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="{{ site.lang | default: 'en' }}">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
  {% seo %}
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="{{ '/assets/css/style.css' | relative_url }}">
  {% feed_meta %}
</head>
<body>
  {% include header.html %}
  <main>
    {{ content }}
  </main>
  {% include footer.html %}
</body>
</html>
```

## Key Elements Explained
1. **{% seo %}**: Jekyll SEO plugin generates title, description, OG tags
2. **{% feed_meta %}**: Adds link to RSS feed in head
3. **{{ content }}**: Where child layouts inject their content
4. **{% include %}**: Pulls in header.html and footer.html

## Implementation Notes
- No JavaScript included (MVP requirement)
- Stylesheet path uses relative_url filter for baseurl compatibility
- lang attribute from site config for accessibility

description:
# Overview

Transform flat surfaces into a layered visual environment with depth, dimension, and tactile quality. This phase adds the shadows, glass effects, and surface treatments that make interfaces feel premium and three-dimensional.

## Background & Justification

World-class dark interfaces (Linear, Raycast, Arc) achieve depth through:
- Layered shadow systems that create hierarchy
- Glass-morphism for navigation and overlays
- Subtle background textures that add tactile quality
- Elevated card surfaces that "float" above the background

Current state: Our surfaces are flat. Everything sits on the same visual plane. There's no sense of depth or hierarchy beyond color.

## Goals

1. Extend color palette with depth tokens (elevated backgrounds, overlays, glows)
2. Implement a layered shadow system (sm, md, lg, glow)
3. Create elevated card components with hover states
4. Add glass-morphism to the header
5. Add subtle background textures for visual interest

## Technical Approach

### Extended Color Palette
```css
/* Depth layers */
--bg-elevated: #1c2128;      /* Cards, modals */
--bg-overlay: rgba(13, 17, 23, 0.8);  /* Overlays */

/* Glow colors */
--glow-primary: rgba(57, 255, 20, 0.3);
--glow-secondary: rgba(0, 255, 255, 0.3);

/* Gradients */
--gradient-primary: linear-gradient(135deg, #39ff14, #00ffff);
--gradient-bg: radial-gradient(ellipse at top, #1a2332, #0d1117);
```

### Shadow System
```css
--shadow-sm: 0 2px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.2);
--shadow-md: 0 4px 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.25);
--shadow-lg: 0 8px 40px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);
--shadow-glow: 0 0 30px var(--glow-primary);
```

### Card Component Specifications
- Background: var(--bg-elevated)
- Border: 1px solid var(--border-color)
- Border-radius: 8px
- Padding: 32px (desktop), 24px (mobile)
- Box-shadow: var(--shadow-md)
- Hover: translateY(-4px), border-color: var(--color-primary), shadow increases

### Glass-Morphism Header
- Background: rgba(22, 27, 34, 0.8)
- backdrop-filter: blur(12px)
- Border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(48, 54, 61, 0.5)
- Scroll shadow: 0 4px 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.3) when scrolled

### Background Textures (subtle)
- Very faint noise texture overlay for tactile feel
- Optional: dot grid pattern suggesting precision
- Gradient orbs: soft, blurred color gradients in strategic positions

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Extended color palette tokens defined
- [ ] Shadow system implemented and documented
- [ ] Card component with hover states working
- [ ] Header has glass-morphism effect
- [ ] Background has subtle texture/gradient
- [ ] Visual hierarchy is immediately apparent
- [ ] Performance not degraded (backdrop-filter can be expensive)

## Dependencies

- **Depends on**: Phase 1 (spacing system needed for card padding)
- **Blocks**: Phase 3 (motion needs surfaces to animate)

## Considerations for Future Work

- backdrop-filter has performance implications on mobile—may need fallback
- Test glass effect in Safari (different rendering)
- Noise texture should be CSS-generated or tiny base64, not external file
- Card hover states prepare the ground for Phase 3 animations

# Epic: Project Foundation & Jekyll Setup

## Overview
This epic covers the foundational setup required before any other work can begin. It establishes the directory structure, dependency management, and core configuration that all other components depend on.

## Strategic Importance
- **Blocking Status**: This is P0 (critical) because EVERY other task depends on the project being properly initialized

## Background & Context
We're building a Jekyll static site for GitHub Pages. Jekyll requires specific directory conventions:
- `_` prefixed directories have special meaning (_layouts, _includes, _posts, _data)
- Gemfile defines Ruby dependencies including Jekyll version and plugins

Inspired by Stripe, Linear, Vercel, Raycast, and Arc Browser—companies known for exceptional design—while maintaining our distinctive terminal/hacker aesthetic. - Strong thematic identity (hacker/terminal aesthetic)
- Good color palette foundation (neon green, cyan, magenta on dark)
- Appropriate typography choice (monospace fonts)

- **Depth**: Flat surfaces, no layered shadows, no glass effects
- **Motion**: Static except cursor blink, no scroll animations
- **Typography**: Functional but not refined, no optical adjustments
- **Spacing**: Adequate but not luxurious, no vertical rhythm

```bash

npx lighthouse https://reforgeit.github.io --view

# Or use Chrome DevTools Lighthouse tab
# Or use PageSpeed Insights: https://pagespeed.web.dev/
```

### Common Performance Issues to Check

1. **Largest Contentful Paint (LCP)**
   - Target: < 2.5s
   - Fix: Optimize hero image (if any), preload fonts

2. **First Input Delay (FID) / Interaction to Next Paint (INP)**
   - Target: < 100ms
   - Fix: Minimize JS, use passive listeners

3. **Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS)**
   - Target: < 0.1
   - Fix: Set explicit dimensions, avoid animation CLS

4. **First Contentful Paint (FCP)**
   - Target: < 1.8s
   - Fix: Inline critical CSS, preconnect fonts

```html
<!-- Preconnect to Google Fonts -->
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com">
<link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com" crossorigin>

<!-- Preload critical font -->
<link rel="preload" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Share+Tech+Mono&display=swap" as="style">
```

```css
/* Prevent CLS from font loading */
body {
  font-display: swap;
}

/* Set explicit dimensions for any images */
img {
  width: 100%;
  height: auto;
  aspect-ratio: 16/9; /* Set appropriate ratio */

h1 {

h1 {

# Task: Add Vertical Rhythm to All Content

## Overview

Establish consistent vertical rhythm across all content so elements align to an invisible baseline grid. This creates subconscious visual harmony.

## Background

Vertical rhythm means all elements align to a common baseline grid. When you overlay an 8px grid on a well-designed site, elements "snap" to lines. This creates:
- Visual harmony even if users don't consciously notice
- Consistent spacing relationships
- Professional, polished appearance

## Implementation Details

### Base Unit: 8px

Every spacing value, line-height, and margin should be a multiple of 8px.

```css
:root {
  --rhythm-unit: 0.5rem; /* 8px */
}

/* Line height calculation:
   Body text at 16px with 1.5 line-height = 24px (3 × 8px) ✓
   Body text at 16px with 1.75 line-height = 28px (3.5 × 8px) - not ideal
   
   Aim for line-heights that produce multiples of 8px */
   
body {
  font-size: 1rem; /* 16px */
  line-height: 1.5; /* = 24px = 3 rhythm units ✓ */
}

h1 {
  font-size: 2rem; /* 32px */
  line-height: 1.25; /* = 40px = 5 rhythm units ✓ */
  margin-bottom: 1.5rem; /* 24px = 3 rhythm units ✓ */
}

h2 {
  font-size: 1.5rem; /* 24px */
  line-height: 1.333; /* = 32px = 4 rhythm units ✓ */
  margin-bottom: 1rem; /* 16px = 2 rhythm units ✓ */
}

p {
  margin-bottom: 1.5rem; /* 24px = 3 rhythm units ✓ */
}
```

### Verification

Create a debug overlay to visualize rhythm:

```css
/* Debug mode - add class to body to visualize */
body.show-rhythm {
  background-image: repeating-linear-gradient(
    to bottom,
    rgba(57, 255, 20, 0.1) 0px,
    rgba(57, 255, 20, 0.1) 1px,
    transparent 1px,
    transparent 8px
  );
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All spacing values are multiples of 8px
- [ ] Line heights produce rhythm-aligned line boxes
- [ ] Headings and paragraphs align to rhythm
- [ ] Debug overlay shows consistent alignment
- [ ] No "drift" as you scroll down a long page

## Files to Modify

- `assets/css/style.scss` - Adjust all spacing to align to rhythm

## Testing

- Add .show-rhythm class to body and verify alignment
- Check multiple pages for consistency
